Docs.summary: Describes the meta data for an installed AppWidget provider.

remarks.para: Describes the meta data for an installed AppWidget provider. The fields in this class correspond to the fields in the <appwidget-provider> xml tag.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: The activity to launch that will configure the AppWidget.

remarks.para: The activity to launch that will configure the AppWidget.
This class name of field corresponds to the android:configure attribute in the AppWidget meta-data file. The package name always corresponds to the package containing the AppWidget provider.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function LoadIcon (context As Context, density As Integer) As Drawable
public: Android::Graphics::Drawables::Drawable ^ LoadIcon(Android::Content::Context ^ context, int density);
public Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable? LoadIcon (Android.Content.Context context, int density);
.method public hidebysig instance class Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable LoadIcon(class Android.Content.Context context, int32 density) cil managed

Docs.param: The optional desired density as per android.util.DisplayMetrics#densityDpi.
Docs.summary: Loads the icon to display for this AppWidget in the AppWidget picker.

remarks.para: Loads the icon to display for this AppWidget in the AppWidget picker. If not supplied in the xml, the application icon will be used. A client can optionally provide a desired density such as android.util.DisplayMetrics#DENSITY_LOWandroid.util.DisplayMetrics#DENSITY_MEDIUM, etc. If no density is provided, the density of the current display will be used.
The loaded icon corresponds to the android:icon attribute in the <receiver> element in the AndroidManifest.xml file.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: The optional desired density as per android.util.DisplayMetrics#densityDpi.
Docs.summary: Loads a preview of what the AppWidget will look like after it's configured.
Docs.returns: The widget preview image or null if preview image is not available.

remarks.para: Loads a preview of what the AppWidget will look like after it's configured. A client can optionally provide a desired density such as android.util.DisplayMetrics#DENSITY_LOWandroid.util.DisplayMetrics#DENSITY_MEDIUM, etc. If no density is provided, the density of the current display will be used.
The loaded image corresponds to the android:previewImage attribute in the <receiver> element in the AndroidManifest.xml file.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

member this.MaxResizeHeight : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Maximum height (in px) which the widget can be resized to.

remarks.para: Maximum height (in px) which the widget can be resized to. This field has no effect if it is smaller than minHeight or if vertical resizing isn't enabled (see #resizeMode).
This field corresponds to the android:maxResizeHeight attribute in the AppWidget meta-data file.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: The default height of the widget when added to a host, in px.

This field corresponds to the android:minHeight attribute in the AppWidget meta-data file.

member this.PreviewImage : int with get, set

Docs.summary: A preview of what the AppWidget will look like after it's configured.

remarks.para: A preview of what the AppWidget will look like after it's configured. If not supplied, the AppWidget's icon will be used.
This field corresponds to the android:previewImage attribute in the AppWidget meta-data file.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int PreviewLayout { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.PreviewLayout : int with get, set

Docs.summary: The layout resource id of a preview of what the AppWidget will look like after it's configured.

remarks.para: The layout resource id of a preview of what the AppWidget will look like after it's configured.
Unlike previewImage, previewLayout can better showcase AppWidget in different locales, system themes, display sizes & density etc.
If supplied, this will take precedence over the previewImage on supported widget hosts. Otherwise, previewImage will be used.
This field corresponds to the android:previewLayout attribute in the AppWidget meta-data file.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int UpdatePeriodMillis { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.UpdatePeriodMillis : int with get, set

Docs.summary: How often, in milliseconds, that this AppWidget wants to be updated.

remarks.para: How often, in milliseconds, that this AppWidget wants to be updated. The AppWidget manager may place a limit on how often a AppWidget is updated.

This field corresponds to the android:updatePeriodMillis attribute in the AppWidget meta-data file.

Note: Updates requested with updatePeriodMillis will not be delivered more than once every 30 minutes.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
